docs.lead_paragraph: Many health insurance providers now link a doctor's reimbursement fees and bonuses to the quality of care provided to patients. But as Dr. Pauline Chen explains in today's Doctor and Patient column, the measures typically used to measure a doctor's performance can be misleading.

headline.main: How Do You Measure Physician Quality?

docs.abstract: The measures typically used to measure physician performance often tell you more about the patient than the doctor, writes Dr. Pauline Chen.
docs.snippet: The measures typically used to measure physician performance often tell you more about the patient than the doctor, writes Dr. Pauline Chen.

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 60 percent of restaurant employees choose to show up for work instead of staying home when they're sick because they have no insurance and no paid sick time, according to a report issued today by a restaurant workers' advocacy group.

headline.main: Restaurant Workers Don't Stay Home When Sick, Study Finds

docs.abstract: More than 60 percent of restaurant employees choose to show up for work instead of staying home when they're sick because they have no insurance and no paid sick time, according to a report issued by a restaurant workers' advocacy group.
docs.snippet: More than 60 percent of restaurant employees choose to show up for work instead of staying home when they're sick because they have no insurance and no paid sick time, according to a report issued by a restaurant workers' advocacy group.

docs.lead_paragraph: Several readers took issue with the idea that Paul Ryan, the ranking Republican on the House Budget Committee, was serious about the deficit. They pointed out that his budget blueprint doesn't live up to its billing as a plan that balances the budget.

headline.main: Is Paul Ryan Serious About the Deficit?

docs.abstract: The Ryan plan wouldn't balance the budget. But it's a lot more serious than some other plans out there.
docs.snippet: The Ryan plan wouldn't balance the budget. But it's a lot more serious than some other plans out there.

docs.lead_paragraph: Many wealthy Democratic patrons, who in the past have played major roles financing outside groups to help elect the party's candidates, are largely sitting out these crucial midterm elections.

headline.main: Democrats Find Many Big Donors Cutting Support

docs.abstract: Many wealthy Democratic patrons, such as George Soros and fellow billionaire Peter B. Lewis, who in the past have played major roles financing outside groups to help elect the party's candidates, are largely sitting out these crucial midterm elections.

docs.lead_paragraph: There's a new tax break for the self-employed buried in the small business jobs legislation that was signed into law on Monday.

headline.main: A New Tax Break for the Self-Employed

docs.abstract: The small business legislation allows self-employed workers to deduct the cost of their health care premiums from their payroll taxes.
docs.snippet: The small business legislation allows self-employed workers to deduct the cost of their health care premiums from their payroll taxes.

docs.lead_paragraph: Casey B. Mulligan is an economics professor at the University of Chicago.

headline.main: Look to Europe to Understand Why This U.S. Recovery Is Jobless

docs.abstract: If the United States expands its social safety net, Americans might enjoy some of the European lifestyle, or recover the jobs lost during this recession, but not both, an economist writes.
docs.snippet: If the United States expands its social safety net, Americans might enjoy some of the European lifestyle, or recover the jobs lost during this recession, but not both, an economist writes.
